abstract: Pennsylvania man Eric Frein pleads not guilty to murder of State Police Trooper Bryon Dickson and related charges; prosecutors say that Frein, a survivalist who spent month on the run after incident, killed Dickson and wounded his partner Alex Douglass in ambush; will seek death penalty.
lead_paragraph: Eric Frein, 31, was charged with first-degree murder, terrorism and other offenses in the Sept. 12 ambush that killed Cpl. Bryon Dickson and severely wounded Trooper Alex Douglass.
snippet: Eric Frein, 31, was charged with first-degree murder, terrorism and other offenses in the Sept. 12 ambush that killed Cpl. Bryon Dickson and severely wounded Trooper Alex Douglass.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Man Accused of Killing a State Trooper Pleads Not Guilty
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Man Accused of Killing a State Trooper Pleads Not Guilty
